channel.title: RevengePK's Resource List
channel.description:
Web design would be a pain in the ass if these didn't exist. I will be sharing with you guys a bunch of things I use that really come in handy.
[b]Icons:[/b]
[url=http://fortawesome.github.com/Font-Awesome/]Font Awesome[/url] [url=http://icomoon.io/]IcoMoon[/url] [url=http://iconmonstr.com/]IconMonstr[/url] [url=http://iconfinder.com]IconFinder[/url]
These are very useful for creating beautiful interfaces/navigation bars. Like the one I have made below!
[img]http://gyazo.com/5e88b56e8b1f0d6e58bbc9ebca41ac62.png?1364362260[/img] [b] Backgrounds[/b]
[url=http://subtlepatterns.com]SubtlePatterns[/url]
[b]Frameworks[/b]
[url=http://twitter.github.com/bootstrap/]Twitter Bootstrap[/url] [url=http://www.getskeleton.com/]Skeleton[/url] - Suggested by [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=534060]Ruby[/url] [url=http://foundation.zurb.com/]Foundation By Zurb[/url] - Suggested bu [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=259364]SilentCJ[/url]
[b]jQuery Plugins[/b]
[url=http://www.jacklmoore.com/colorbox/]Colorbox - ajQuery lightbox[/url] - An easily implementable jQuery lightbox with many options and designs that will suit just about any website design out of the box.
[url=http://onehackoranother.com/projects/jquery/tipsy/]Tipsy.js[/url] - A Facebook style tooltip plugin. Very useful and easy to implement. Uses the "title" attribute. Stores the original "title" attribute in a new attribute called "Original-Title" if you need to grab it.
[url=http://www.woothemes.com/flexslider/]Flexslider by WooThemes[/url] - A responsive jQuery slide plugin that supports just about any content. Very easy to implement into any web application.
I will be adding to this list every now and then!

item.title: RevengePK's Resource List
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

Thread updated with the suggested frameworks and more jQuery plugins with short descriptions of what they do.

item.title: RevengePK's Resource List
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:7, topic:510496”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=628743.msg4269220#msg4269220 date=1364390968]

You should probably add Skeleton to the frameworks part, it’s a very, very good framework.

Throw on Foundation by Zurb as well, new framework but it’s gaining huge popularity amongst developers.
[/quote]
Just handed that to the vInsert 07 bot web developer, it’s a loveing brilliant framework. Thanks for linking it :P.[/quote]

I’m actually thinking about picking that up and practicing a bit with it.

Read full topic

item.title: RevengePK's Resource List
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

Web design would be a pain in the ass if these didn’t exist. I will be sharing with you guys a bunch of things I use that really come in handy.

Icons:

Font Awesome
IcoMoon
IconMonstr
IconFinder

These are very useful for creating beautiful interfaces/navigation bars. Like the one I have made below!

5e88b56e8b1f0d6e58bbc9ebca41ac62.png?13643622601039×68


Backgrounds

SubtlePatterns

Frameworks

Twitter Bootstrap
Skeleton - Suggested by Ruby
Foundation By Zurb - Suggested bu SilentCJ

jQuery Plugins

Colorbox - ajQuery lightbox - An easily implementable jQuery lightbox with many options and designs that will suit just about any website design out of the box.

Tipsy.js - A Facebook style tooltip plugin. Very useful and easy to implement. Uses the “title” attribute. Stores the original “title” attribute in a new attribute called “Original-Title” if you need to grab it.

Flexslider by WooThemes - A responsive jQuery slide plugin that supports just about any content. Very easy to implement into any web application.

I will be adding to this list every now and then!

Read full topic
